author: Staff Reporter
text:
Driver remanded in judicial custody

Nine people were injured when a driver lost control of his vehicle in Pallavaram on Sunday. The driver, police said, was under the influence of alcohol and lost control of his taxi.

E. Gunasekaran of Annai Sathya Nagar, Pammal, was returning home from the Chennai airport. Near P.P. Amman Koil Street and Anjaneyar Koil Street in Pallavaram, he lost control of the car, which first hit a pedestrian. The speeding car then climbed on the pavement and ploughed into a bakery and a fast food centre and came to a halt after ramming a petty shop.

In the accident, pedestrian Mohammed Asin (34) and eight others, including Thara Begum (59), Ameer John (36) and Adnan Hussain (11) were injured.

Onlookers rushed to the rescue of the injured and found Gunasekaran under the influence of alcohol. Chromepet Traffic Investigation Wing has registered a case. The injured, the police said, were out of danger. The driver was remanded in judicial custody on Monday, police said.

title: Drunk driver runs amok, injures nine
